intro: Edwinia californica, commonly known as the California edwinia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along streambanks and in wetlands. Edwinia californica is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for native wildlife.
